intro: Hopea ponga var. ponga, commonly known as the Pongam tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish-brown bark and alternate, simple leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, flat, woody pods containing several seeds. It is known for its ability to thrive in various soil types and is often found in lowland forests. The plant has traditional uses in medicine and also serves as a source of fuel and timber.
